forms_create_first: Create your first form to get started
forms_select_or_create: Select a form or create a new one
forms_upload_hint: Click to upload or drag and drop
import_from_file: Import from CSV or Excel file
file_appears_empty: The file appears to be empty.
found_headers_no_data: Found headers at row {0}, but no data rows.
delete_group_description: This will permanently remove the group and all tasks within it.
name: Name
no_dependencies: No dependencies. This task can start anytime.
no_tasks_waiting: No tasks are waiting on this one.
dependency_finish_to_start_desc: Must finish before this can start
dependency_start_to_start_desc: Must start before this can start
dependency_finish_to_finish_desc: Must finish before this can finish
dependency_start_to_finish_desc: Must finish before this can start
no_tags_yet: No tags yet. Type to create one.
please_enter_valid_email: Please enter a valid email address
reports_desc: Centralized access to all system reports
eo_info_overview_text: This dashboard provides a high-level view of all operational expenses, tracking total spend, daily averages, and category distribution to identify cost drivers.
eo_total_expenses_desc: Sum of all recorded expenses in period.
eo_monthly_expenses_desc: Total expenses incurred in current month.
eo_expense_growth_desc: MoM or YoY percentage change in spend.
eo_fixed_variable_desc: Ratio of static to dynamic costs.
eo_by_category_desc: Bar chart showing top spending buckets.
ca_info_overview_text: This dashboard analyzes spending by category, comparing actual expenditures to budgets and highlighting areas of over or underspending.
ca_info_a2: A flag raised when any category deviates significantly (e.g., >10%) from its budget.
ca_info_a3: (Total Budget - Total Variance) / Total Budget, expressed as a percentage.
fv_info_overview_text: This dashboard separates expenses into fixed (predictable, recurring) and variable (fluctuating) buckets, helping you understand cost flexibility and potential for reduction.
fv_info_a1: Costs that don't change month-to-month, such as rent, salaries, or long-term subscriptions.
fv_info_a2: Costs that fluctuate based on activity levels, like utilities, raw materials, or project-based spending.
fv_info_a3: The proportion of variable costs to total costs. Higher ratio = more flexibility to cut expenses if needed.
fv_info_q4: How can I reduce fixed costs?
fv_fixed_expenses_desc: Sum of all recurring, committed costs.
fv_variable_expenses_desc: Sum of all dynamic, fluctuating costs.
fv_fixed_breakdown_desc: Pie chart of fixed cost composition.
fv_variable_breakdown_desc: Pie chart of variable cost composition.
ta_info_overview_text: This dashboard identifies spending trends over time and flags unusual transactions or patterns that may indicate errors, fraud, or one-time events.
ta_info_a1: A data point that deviates significantly from the expected pattern, often defined as >2 standard deviations from the mean.
ta_info_a2: By calculating the slope of a best-fit line through daily expense data. Positive slope = increasing trend.
ta_info_a3: Any single day or transaction that exceeds a threshold (e.g., 3x the average daily expense).
af_info_overview_text: This dashboard monitors the expense approval pipeline, tracking submission rates, approval times, and identifying bottlenecks in the workflow.
af_info_q1: Why are expenses pending so long?
af_info_a2: The percentage of submitted expenses that get approved. Low rates may indicate policy issues or documentation problems.
af_info_q3: How can I speed up approvals?
af_avg_time_desc: Average days from submission to decision.
da_info_overview_text: This dashboard breaks down expenses by department, assigning accountability for budget variances and tracking efficiency across the organization.
da_info_a3: A score derived from budget adherence, timely approvals, and policy compliance per department.
da_info_a4: Ratio of output (if measured) or budget utilization vs targets. Higher is better, indicating effective resource use.
da_shared_costs_desc: Headcounts usually determine shared facility cost allocation unless direct usage is measured.
fo_info_overview_text: This dashboard predicts future spending based on historical data and identifies specific opportunities to reduce costs through optimization strategies.
fo_info_a1: We use a linear regression model based on the last 6 months of expense data, adjusted for known seasonality.
fo_info_a2: The estimated savings amount if all recommended actions (e.g., switching vendors, bulk buying) are implemented.
fo_info_a3: It reflects the statistical variance of the forecast model. Lower variance means higher confidence.
fo_landscape_desc: Visualizing easy wins vs hard savings.
fo_time_series_desc: Basic linear extrapolation with seasonal adjustments for recurring annual expenses.
supplier_overview_desc: This dashboard provides a consolidated view of the supplier base, tracking key metrics such as total spend, engagement levels, and overall performance ratings to support strategic sourcing decisions.
supplier_performance_desc: Supplier performance, relationships, and spend analysis.
supplier_overview_info_desc: This dashboard provides a holistic view of the supplier base, tracking acquisition, performance, and overall relationship health to ensure supply chain stability.
supplier_a1: A supplier who has fulfilled at least one order in the last 90 days.
supplier_a2: Suppliers with quality scores below 80% or on-time delivery rates below 85%.
supplier_a3: Based on defect rates, compliance audits, and customer feedback weighted by order volume.
supplier_a4: The average number of days from order placement to delivery completion.
total_suppliers_desc: Count of active suppliers with recent transactions.
on_time_delivery_desc: Percentage of orders delivered on or before the promised date.
quality_score_desc: Average quality rating across all suppliers.
avg_order_value_desc: Average amount a customer spends per transaction. Higher is better.
supplier_growth_desc: Growth trend of supplier base over time.
tier_definition_desc: Preferred = Top 15% by performance. Active = Regular orders. At Risk = Performance issues detected.
supplier_performance_info_desc: Track and compare supplier performance across quality, delivery, cost, and responsiveness metrics to identify top performers and improvement opportunities.
perf_q1: Are sales growth numbers healthy or inflated?
perf_a1: Weighted average: Quality (30%), Delivery (30%), Cost (25%), Response (15%).
perf_q2: Are customers buying again or only once?
perf_a2: Any metric dropping below 80% or a 5+ point decline month-over-month.
perf_q3: Are discounts driving sales at the cost of margin?
perf_a3: Scores are recalculated daily based on the rolling 90-day performance window.
perf_q4: Where are orders failing or being cancelled?
perf_a4: Industry standard targets: Quality 95%, Delivery 98%, Cost 100%, Response 4h.
response_time_info: Average time to respond to inquiries.
risk_compliance_info_desc: Monitor supplier risk levels, track compliance certifications, and identify potential supply chain vulnerabilities before they impact operations.
risk_a1: Combines financial stability, delivery reliability, quality history, and market factors.
risk_q2: What triggers a High Risk status?
risk_a2: Risk score above 70, expired certifications, or multiple unresolved incidents.
risk_a3: Critical suppliers: quarterly. Standard suppliers: annually. New suppliers: within 30 days.
supplier_orders_info_desc: Track purchase orders from placement to delivery, monitor order status, and identify delivery delays or issues requiring attention.
orders_a1: Percentage of orders delivered by the expected date.
orders_q2: When is an order marked as Delayed?
orders_a2: When the current date exceeds the expected delivery date without receipt.
orders_a3: Average days between order placement and delivery confirmation.
auto_model_selection: I automatically choose the right tier (1-5) based on your question complexity.
no_board_context_hint: No board/room context. Open a board to enable context-aware responses.
ai_disabled_hint: AI is disabled. Right-click to enable.
key_sales_metrics_desc: Key sales metrics and revenue distribution overview
operational_leakage_analysis: Operational leakage and fulfillment efficiency analysis
views_to_orders_path: Hidden story: Views to Orders path
comparing_current_trends: Comparing current trends with future projections
scatter_analysis_desc: Scatter analysis: Bubble size = Projected Revenue, Red Bubbles = High Deviation
webcam_insight: Webcam 4K shows 52% upward deviation—potential high-growth opportunity if stock is secured.
customer_overview_a1: A customer who has placed at least one order in the last 90 days.
customer_overview_a2: Customers who have not purchased in the last 12 months despite having previous activity.
customer_overview_a3: The percentage of active customers who visit the store or interact with emails weekly.
customer_overview_a4: It compares the total active customer base size of the current month vs. the previous month.
total_customers_desc: Lifetime registered customer count across all channels.
active_customers_desc: Customers with at least one interaction in the last 90 days.
new_customers_desc: Count of new customer acquisitions in the current month.
segment_definition_desc: VIP = Top 10% by spend. Loyal = >5 orders. New = <30 days since first order.
segmentation_q1: Which customer segments drive the most revenue?
segmentation_a1: Based on total lifetime spend: VIP (top 10%), Premium (next 20%), Regular (middle 50%), New (recent 30 days).
segmentation_a2: The percentage of total revenue contributed by each customer segment.
segmentation_a3: The Repeat Customer % and Loyalty Curve show retention success. Compare repeat vs one-time purchase patterns across segments to measure program effectiveness.
value_distribution_desc: Companion chart showing revenue distribution across segment tiers.
behavior_a1: Average number of orders per customer within the analysis period.
behavior_a2: Average number of items or total value per order.
behavior_a3: Average days between consecutive orders for repeat customers.
retention_a1: Percentage of customers who made repeat purchases within the period.
retention_a2: Customers showing declining purchase frequency or engagement compared to their historical average.
retention_a3: ML-based probability score indicating likelihood of customer churning in next 90 days.
churn_rate_desc: Percentage of customers who stopped purchasing in the analysis period.
journey_a1: Any interaction point between customer and brand: website visit, email, support call, purchase, etc.
journey_a2: Sequence of touchpoints leading to a purchase, attributed using first-touch or multi-touch models.
journey_a3: Percentage of customers who exit the journey at each stage without completing purchase.
satisfaction_a1: Net Promoter Score: % Promoters (9-10) minus % Detractors (0-6) from survey responses.
satisfaction_a2: Customer Satisfaction Score: percentage of customers rating experience as satisfied or very satisfied.
satisfaction_a3: Natural language processing on reviews and feedback to classify as positive, neutral, or negative.
forecast_a1: By comparing actual sales against weighted forecasts, we can see if performance is meeting expectations.
forecast_a2: The Decision Table highlights deviations, flagging items that are significantly underperforming relative to their forecast.
forecast_q3: Are trends linear or changing unexpectedly?
forecast_a3: Our predictive models look for subtle shifts in historical data that might indicate a non-linear trend change.
segmentation_overview_desc: This dashboard classifies customers based on their monetary value and behavioral patterns, helping to prioritize retention efforts and identify growth opportunities.
segmentation_info_a1: Customers whose total lifetime spend exceeds $10,000.
segmentation_info_a2: The percentage of total revenue generated by the top 20% of customers (Pareto Principle).
segmentation_info_a4: Groups with a high churn probability or declining spend trends over the last quarter.
tier_counts_desc: Number of High, Mid, and Low value clients.
top_customers_desc: Ranked table of highest-value customers with engagement metrics.
rfm_model_desc: We use Recency, Frequency, and Monetary value to score and assign customers to tiers.
behavior_overview_desc: This dashboard uncovers deep insights into how customers interact with the brand, highlighting purchase cycles, product preferences, and behavioral anomalies.
behavior_info_a1: It measures the deviation of purchase volume in the current season relative to the annual average (e.g., 1.2 = 20% higher).
behavior_info_a2: Based on the variance in order frequency. High volatility means unpredictable buying patterns.
behavior_info_a3: Significant deviations from established norms, such as a regular buyer suddenly stopping or a spike in returns.
behavior_info_a4: The distribution of product categories within the average customer basket.
next_purchase_prediction_desc: Calculated using historical inter-purchase time distributions for each customer segment.
retention_overview_desc: This dashboard tracks customer retention patterns and identifies early warning signs of churn to enable proactive intervention strategies.
retention_info_a1: A customer who has not made a purchase in 12+ months despite having previous activity.
retention_info_a2: Number of customers at end of period minus new customers, divided by customers at start of period.
retention_info_a3: Average time from first to last purchase for churned customers.
retention_info_a4: ML model flags customers whose behavior patterns match historical churn profiles.
retention_tactics_desc: Personalized offers, loyalty rewards, and re-engagement campaigns based on customer segment.
journey_overview_desc: This dashboard visualizes the complete customer journey from awareness to purchase and beyond, identifying key conversion points and friction areas.
journey_info_a1: Credits the first marketing channel that brought the customer to your brand.
journey_info_a2: Days from first brand interaction to first purchase.
journey_info_a3: Small actions (newsletter signup, wishlist add) that indicate purchase intent.
journey_info_a4: Weighted combination of touchpoint engagement, velocity, and recency.
attribution_model_desc: Multi-touch attribution assigns credit across all touchpoints based on position and recency.
satisfaction_overview_desc: This dashboard aggregates customer feedback from all channels to provide a comprehensive view of satisfaction and identify improvement opportunities.
satisfaction_info_a1: Above 50 is excellent, 30-50 is good, 0-30 needs improvement, below 0 is critical.
satisfaction_info_a2: Real-time for support tickets, daily for reviews, weekly for social mentions.
satisfaction_info_a3: NLP analysis of text feedback weighted by recency and source reliability.
satisfaction_info_a4: Clustering of negative feedback by topic to surface recurring issues.
satisfaction_scoring_desc: Composite score combining NPS, CSAT, and sentiment analysis weighted by sample size.
forecast_risk_overview_desc: This dashboard uses predictive analytics to forecast customer lifetime value and identify potential risks for proactive management.
forecast_info_q1: How far ahead does CLV predict?
forecast_info_a1: Standard model predicts 12-month forward value with monthly updates.
forecast_info_a2: Declining engagement, increased support contacts, missed payments, or explicit dissatisfaction.
forecast_info_a3: Sum of predicted CLV for all customers flagged as high churn risk.
forecast_info_a4: Statistical measure of prediction reliability based on data quality and pattern consistency.
forecast_methodology_desc: BG/NBD model for purchase probability combined with Gamma-Gamma for monetary value prediction.
take_break: Take a break and have some fun
invite_member_desc: Invite team members to collaborate on your workspace
pages_appear_here: Pages you visit will appear here
subject: Subject
connect_inbox_desc: Sync your work email to manage everything in one place. We support Gmail and Outlook.
connect_terms: By connecting, you agree to grant read/write access to your emails.
must_be_logged_in: You must be logged in to connect an account.
move_to_trash_confirm: This email will be moved to your trash folder.
disconnect_confirm: Are you sure you want to disconnect this email account? You will stop receiving updates.
dashboards_page_desc: Centralized view of all department dashboards
type_task_enter: Type your task and press Enter...
please_enter_board_name: Please enter a board name and select a workspace.
delete_board_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this board? This action cannot be undone.
delete_workspace_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this workspace? All boards within it will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.
cannot_delete_only_workspace: Cannot delete the only workspace. Create another one first.
has_sub_boards_warning: This board contains nested sub-boards. How would you like to handle them?
delete_single_board_desc: Sub-boards will be moved to the parent level.
inventory_insights_desc: All dashboards in one scrollable view
inventory_overview_desc: Key metrics and KPIs for inventory health
io_info_overview_text: Get a complete snapshot of your inventory health. Track stock value, availability rates, and identify items that need attention.
io_info_q1: What is my total inventory value?
io_info_q2: How many products do I have?
io_info_q3: What items are out of stock?
io_info_total_value_desc: Sum of (cost × quantity) for all inventory items
io_info_total_skus_desc: Count of unique product codes in the system
io_info_out_of_stock_desc: Number of items with zero quantity on hand
io_info_low_stock_desc: Items below their minimum stock threshold
io_info_avg_age_desc: Average days since items were received
io_info_turnover_desc: How many times inventory is sold and replaced per period
io_info_stock_category_desc: Bar chart showing stock value distribution by category
io_info_warehouse_dist_desc: Pie chart of inventory spread across warehouses
io_info_inventory_list_desc: Detailed table with all items, quantities, and values
io_info_radial_map_desc: Visual density map of stock concentration
io_table_inventory_items_desc: Core inventory data with quantities and costs
stock_movement_desc: Track inbound and outbound stock flows
accuracy_shrinkage_desc: Monitor stock accuracy and shrinkage losses
forecast_risk_desc: Forecast demand and assess inventory risks
identify_slow_moving_aging: Identify slow-moving, aging, and dead stock
ia_info_a1: Inventory that has not moved in a specific timeframe (e.g., > 180 days). It ties up capital and space.
ia_info_a2: Aging Inventory Value and Capital Locked % quantify the financial impact of slow-moving items.
ia_info_a3: Check Clearance Targets and Slow Moving SKUs. These are prime targets for discounts or bundles.
ia_info_a4: Monitor Avg Stock Age. A decreasing trend suggests better flow and fresher inventory.
ia_info_overview_text: This dashboard identifies slow-moving, aging, and dead inventory to help free up capital and warehouse space.
ia_info_avg_age_desc: Mean days since receipt for current inventory.
ia_info_aging_value_desc: Value of items older than 90 days.
ia_info_dead_value_desc: Value of items older than 365 days (or custom threshold).
ia_info_stock_90_desc: Portion of total inventory value considered aging.
ia_info_capital_desc: Percentage of total capital tied up in dead stock.
ia_info_buckets_desc: Bar chart grouping stock by age tiers (0-30, 31-60, etc.).
ia_info_dist_desc: Pie chart showing value split by age group.
ia_info_risk_desc: Table listing oldest and slowest items.
ia_info_spiral_desc: Visualizes the aging process and decay over time.
if_info_q1: How much stock will we need?
if_info_a1: See Forecasted Stock Demand. This predicts future item requirements based on historical sales trends.
if_info_a2: Check Forecast Accuracy and Confidence Level. Higher percentages indicate the model fits past data well.
if_info_a3: Risk Exposure and Supply Volatility highlight areas where supply might not meet demand or exceed it.
if_info_a4: The Recommended Action column in the detailed table suggests outcome-based steps like Reorder Now or Monitor.
if_info_overview_text: This dashboard uses predictive modeling to forecast inventory requirements and identify potential supply chain risks before they impact operations.
if_info_demand_desc: Projected units needed for next period.
if_info_risk_desc: Portion of inventory vulnerable to supply shock.
if_info_overstock_desc: Items predicted to exceed max limits.
if_info_cone_desc: Visualizes the range of possible future outcomes.
sa_info_a1: Inventory loss due to theft, damage, errors, or unknown causes. It is the difference between recorded and actual stock.
sa_info_a2: It calculates the percentage of SKUs where system quantity matches physical count exactly during audits.
sa_info_a3: Items that frequently show discrepancies or have high value and are prone to theft or loss.
sa_info_a4: Any discrepancy exceeding a predefined threshold (e.g., > 5% value difference) generates an immediate alert.
sa_info_overview_text: This dashboard tracks mismatches between system balances and physical verification, highlighting losses (shrinkage) and operational errors.
sa_info_accuracy_desc: Ratio of correct SKU counts to total audited SKUs.
sa_info_shrinkage_desc: Total monetary loss from missing inventory.
sa_info_adjustment_desc: Number of manual stock corrections made.
sa_info_loss_desc: Shrinkage as a percentage of total inventory value.
sa_info_risk_desc: Items with repeated or high-value discrepancies.
sa_info_shrinkage_cat_desc: Pie chart categorizing loss reasons (Theft, Damaged, Admin).
sa_info_variance_log_desc: Table calling out specific SKU discrepancies.
sa_info_radar_desc: Visualizes accuracy gaps across multiple dimensions.
sm_info_q4: How is stock entering vs leaving?
sm_info_overview_text: This dashboard tracks the heartbeat of inventory: what is coming in, what is going out, and where bottlenecks are slowing down operations.
sm_info_inout_desc: Total units received vs shipped in the period.
sm_info_net_desc: Difference between incoming and outgoing stock.
sm_info_frequency_desc: Number of distinct stock transactions per day.
sm_info_bottleneck_desc: SKUs with high dwell time or processing delays.
sm_info_volatility_desc: Standard deviation of daily movement counts.
sm_info_inout_cat_desc: Bar chart comparing direction volume by category.
sm_info_types_desc: Pie chart for receipts, shipments, returns.
sm_info_sankey_desc: Visualizes the path of stock from source to destination.
start_new_discussion_desc: Select a channel or start a new discussion to begin talking.
to_create_task_chat: to create a new task directly from chat.
select_or_start_conversation: Choose a conversation from the sidebar or start a new one
send_first_message: Send the first message to start the conversation
select_conversation_to_see_data: Select a conversation to see tasks & reminders
save_to_vault_desc: Keep a copy in your secure vault
chat_closed_participant: The team member who created this chat has closed it. You can't send messages anymore.
chat_deleted_participant: This chat has been deleted by the owner.
confirm_close_chat: Are you sure you want to close this chat? Participants will no longer be able to send messages.
confirm_delete_chat: Are you sure you want to delete this chat? This action cannot be undone.
manage_profile_desc: Manage your profile and workspace preferences.
switch_theme_desc: Switch between light and dark mode
schedule_event_desc: Schedule a new event for your project
create_task_in_board: Create a task in a board
enter_view_name: Enter new name for this view:
confirm_archive_tasks: Are you sure you want to archive all tasks in this group?
confirm_delete_group: Are you sure you want to delete this group? All tasks within it will be deleted.
press_enter_to_save: Press Enter to save to Inbox
check_other_tabs: Check other tabs or enjoy your break.
inbox_empty_capture_more: Your inbox is empty. Go capture more things.
favorites_empty_desc: Mark important items as favorites to access them quickly from here.
empty_folder_desc: This folder is empty. Start by creating a new {category}.
add_new_items_folder: Add new items specifically to this folder.
logins_empty_desc: Store your passwords and credentials securely. Add your first login to get started.
weblinks_empty_desc: Save important websites and bookmarks for quick access.
notes_empty_desc: Create secure notes to store sensitive information like recovery codes or PINs.
images_empty_desc: Upload images and screenshots to store them securely.
documents_empty_desc: Upload important documents like contracts, IDs, or certificates.
folders_empty_desc: Create folders to organize your vault items into categories.
trash_empty_desc: Deleted items will appear here. You can restore or permanently delete them.
empty_category_desc: This category is empty. Add items to see them here.
vault_empty_desc: Your vault is empty. Store passwords, secure notes, and sensitive documents with bank-grade encryption.
login_security_notice: Your credentials are stored securely. We recommend using unique passwords for each account.
secure_note_notice: This note will be stored securely. Perfect for sensitive information like recovery codes, PINs, or private keys.
logistics_tracking_desc: Logistics tracking, delivery performance, and route optimization.
press_esc_to_pause: Press ESC while playing to pause the game
desc_asteroids: Navigate your ship through space and destroy asteroids to survive!
desc_snake: Classic snake game. Eat food to grow!
desc_tetris: Stack falling blocks to clear lines.
desc_breakout: Bounce the ball and break all the bricks. Collect power-ups!
desc_pong: Classic paddle game against AI. First to 7 points wins!
desc_sudoku: Fill the grid so every row, column, and 3x3 box has 1-9!
customize_sidebar_desc: Customize which pages appear in your sidebar.
toggle_pages_desc: Toggle pages on or off to customize your experience.
use_quick_notes_hint: If you want to write a quick note use NABD Bar
vehicle_status_desc: Vehicle status, maintenance schedules, and utilization.
forecasting_desc: Forecasting, demand sensing, and supply alignment.
live_inventory_positioning: Live inventory positioning and facility status
enable_gemini_api: Enable Gemini API to see live recommendations.
add_gemini_api_key: Add VITE_GEMINI_API_KEY to enable Smart Tips.
ai_standing_by: AI is standing by with recommendations.
select_storage_bin: Select a storage bin on the map to see details
each_item_glance: Each item in this request at a glance
no_items_captured: No items captured for this request.
general_sales_insights: General sales insights and key metrics
overview_coming_soon_desc: This will be the general sales overview with aggregated insights from all dashboards. Use the other tabs to view detailed sales dashboards.
purchase_overview_subtitle: Snapshot of purchasing activity and supplier engagement
forecast_planning_desc: Predict future needs and budget impact
distribution_category_dependency: Distribution across categories and supplier dependency
po_info_overview_text: This dashboard provides a high-level snapshot of purchasing activity, spending patterns, and supplier engagement for small businesses.
po_info_a3: Review the Spend Concentration chart. Even distribution across categories with low primary supplier % indicates healthy diversification; high concentration indicates dependency risk.
po_info_total_spend_desc: Total value of approved purchase orders in the current period.
po_info_total_orders_desc: Count of all purchase orders placed.
po_info_active_suppliers_desc: Number of unique suppliers engaged in the period.
po_info_avg_value_desc: Total Spend / Total Orders. Indicates typical deal size.
po_info_monthly_change_desc: Percentage difference in spend compared to the previous month.
po_info_top_supplier_desc: Percentage of total spend going to the #1 supplier.
po_info_frequency_desc: Average number of purchases per active interval.
po_info_unplanned_desc: Percentage of purchase orders created outside the approved purchasing plan or budget.
po_info_supplier_chart_desc: Bar chart verifying top partners by volume.
po_info_category_chart_desc: Bar chart identifying cost centers (e.g. IT, Office).
po_info_share_desc: Pie chart showing market share of suppliers.
po_info_orders_table_desc: Table listing details of recent approved purchases.
po_info_concentration_desc: Marimekko chart showing how total purchasing is distributed across categories, highlighting dependency risk and diversification balance.
po_table_purchase_orders_desc: Main source for spend and counts.
po_info_date_range_desc: Currently reflects YTD or rolling 12 months.
pb_info_overview_text: This dashboard uncovers hidden purchasing behaviors and patterns.
pb_info_q1: Is our purchasing reactive or planned?
pb_info_a1: Check Purchase Frequency and Avg Order Gap.
pb_info_q3: Do we have seasonal spending spikes?
pb_info_a3: Review Seasonal Index and Temporal Purchase Wave.
pb_info_q4: Are there anomalies in our spending?
pb_info_a4: Spike Detection and Irregular Purchase highlight unusual transactions.
pb_info_a5: Category Mix and Orders per Category charts reveal administrative effort.
pb_info_frequency_desc: Average purchase orders created per month.
pb_info_repeat_desc: Percentage of items ordered more than once.
pb_info_orders_chart_desc: Bar chart showing volume by category.
pb_info_velocity_chart_desc: Bar chart showing monthly order trends.
pb_info_source_chart_desc: Pie chart showing purchase initiation types.
pb_info_table_desc: Breakdown of order count and value by category.
pb_info_heatmap_desc: Heatmap of weekly order density patterns.
pb_table_items_desc: Line item details for category analysis.
supplier_health_stable_msg: Overall supplier health is stable. 8 Preferred Suppliers are maintaining 95%+ performance.
spend_vs_lead_time_risk: Spend vs lead time with risk indicators
supplier_overview_a1: Suppliers with at least one active purchase order or transaction in the last 6 months.
supplier_overview_a2: A weighted average of delivery performance (40%), quality metrics (30%), and pricing/cost adherence (30%).
supplier_overview_a3: The aggregated value of all approved purchase orders and direct expenses attributed to suppliers year-to-date.
supplier_overview_a4: Based on geographic stability, financial health reports, and dependency concentration (single vs multi-source).
supplier_total_suppliers_desc: Count of all registered vendor profiles.
supplier_matrix_desc: Bubble chart of Spend vs Rating vs Risk.
supplier_delivery_desc: This dashboard evaluates supplier reliability by tracking delivery times, accuracy, and punctuality, helping to identify bottlenecks and ensure supply chain continuity.
supplier_delivery_a1: The percentage of orders delivered on or before the promised delivery date, measured against total orders received.
supplier_delivery_a2: Any shipment arriving more than 24 hours past the agreed delivery window.
supplier_delivery_a3: The average number of days between purchase order issuance and goods receipt.
supplier_delivery_a4: Based on the correctness of items, quantities, and documentation for each shipment (perfect order rate).
supplier_cost_desc: This dashboard empowers finance teams to monitor supplier costs, analyze variance against contracts, and identify opportunities for savings and consolidation.
supplier_cost_a1: The percentage difference between the contracted or budgeted cost and the actual invoiced amount.
supplier_cost_a2: Based on negotiated discounts, volume rebates, and cost avoidance strategies implemented in the current fiscal year.
supplier_cost_a3: Visualizes how much of the total procurement budget is allocated to specific suppliers or categories, highlighting dependency risks.
supplier_cost_a4: It helps identify tail spend (many small vendors) versus strategic consolidation opportunities.
supplier_quality_desc: This dashboard monitors supplier product quality and adherence to regulatory standards. It tracks defect rates, inspection outcomes, and compliance scores to mitigate risk and ensure high standards.
supplier_quality_a1: The number of defective units divided by total units received, expressed as a percentage.
supplier_quality_a2: A composite score based on adherence to regulatory standards (ISO, RoHS), documentation accuracy, and timely audit completions.
supplier_quality_a3: Any severe non-conformance event requiring a formal Corrective Action Report (CAR) or halting production.
supplier_quality_a4: A supplier with a Compliance Score below 70% or more than 3 critical quality incidents in a rolling 12-month period.
supplier_defect_rate_desc: Percentage of failed units per total received.
supplier_quality_score_desc: 0-100 rating based on defect rate and consistency.
supplier_compliance_score_desc: Adherence to legal and safety standards.
supplier_defects_by_supplier_desc: Comparison of defect counts across vendors.
supplier_metrics_radar_desc: Multi-axis view of Quality, Delivery, and Compliance.
supplier_defect_categories_desc: Breakdown of defect types (e.g., cosmetic, functional).
supplier_leadtime_desc: This view analyzes supplier agility and reliability. It tracks lead time consistency, responsiveness to RFQs, and handling of urgent requests to optimize supply chain speed.
supplier_leadtime_a1: The average number of days between purchase order issuance and good receipts notification.
supplier_leadtime_a2: A metric combining quote turnaround time (RFQ), urgent order acceptance rate, and communication speed.
supplier_leadtime_a3: Standard deviation of delivery times against the quoted lead time, indicating process stability.
supplier_leadtime_a4: Orders placed with a requested delivery date less than 50% of standard lead time.
supplier_avg_leadtime_desc: Mean time from order to delivery.
supplier_fastest_supplier_desc: Vendor with shortest reliable lead time.
supplier_response_time_rfq_desc: Avg hours to quote on new requests.
supplier_leadtime_distribution_desc: Box plot of delivery times by supplier.
supplier_response_speed_desc: Ranked view of supplier quoting speed.
supplier_risk_desc: This view highlights supply chain vulnerabilities. It identifies critical single points of failure, overly high dependency on specific vendors, and tracks potential disruption risks.
supplier_risk_a1: The proportion of total category spend or volume allocated to a single supplier.
supplier_risk_a2: A critical component or service provided by only one vendor with no immediate alternative verified.
supplier_risk_a3: Weighted average of financial stability, geopolitical risk, and dependency concentration.
supplier_risk_a4: Any incident (natural disaster, strike, insolvency) causing a delay greater than 7 days.
supplier_single_source_desc: Count of vendors with no approved backup.
supplier_dependency_pct_desc: Highest spend concentration on one vendor.
supplier_backup_coverage_desc: % of critical parts with alternate sourcing.
supplier_value_desc: This dashboard identifies high-value potential within the supply base. It focuses on strategic alignment, innovation contribution, and sustainable growth partnerships.
supplier_value_a1: A partner with high alignment to long-term goals, delivering critical components or innovation.
supplier_value_a2: Based on the number of joint R&D projects, patents co-developed, and new product introductions enabled.
supplier_value_a3: A composite metric (0-100) reflecting relationship strength, trust, and mutual investment levels.
supplier_value_a4: Year-over-year increase in procurement volume, indicating deepening operational integration.
supplier_growth_matrix_desc: Scatter plot of Growth Rate vs Strategic Value.
supplier_contract_structure_desc: Breakdown of agreement types (Long-term vs Spot).
pf_info_overview_text: This dashboard tracks the lifecycle of purchase requests from submission to final approval, highlighting bottlenecks, delays, and approval efficiency.
pf_info_q2: How many requests are we rejecting?
pf_info_q4: What is the volume of our pipeline?
pf_info_q5: How do requests flow through the system?
pf_info_requests_desc: Total number of new purchase requests initiated.
pf_info_approved_desc: Requests that have successfully passed all approval stages.
pf_info_approval_time_desc: Average duration from submission to final decision.
pf_info_approval_rate_desc: Percentage of submitted requests that get approved.
pf_info_bottleneck_desc: The approval stage with the highest average delay.
pf_info_delayed_desc: Count of active requests exceeding the SLA time limit.
pf_info_sla_desc: Percentage of requests approved within target timeframes.
pf_info_funnel_chart_desc: Funnel chart showing volume drop-off at each stage.
pf_info_hours_chart_desc: Bar chart showing average processing time at each step.
pf_info_volume_chart_desc: Bar chart showing monthly request submission patterns.
pf_info_status_chart_desc: Pie chart showing breakdown of approved, pending, rejected, and cancelled requests.
pf_info_status_table_desc: Detailed list of active requests and their current aging.
pf_info_sankey_desc: Sankey diagram visualizing the multi-path flow of approvals.
pf_calc_delayed: Current Date - Stage Entry Date > Stage SLA.
dashboard_overview_desc: This dashboard gives you a quick snapshot of your sales health. It helps you understand how much you are selling, profitability, and trends—all in one place.
total_sales_desc: Gross revenue before any deductions. The top-line number.
net_revenue_desc: Real money earned after discounts and returns. The bottom-line.
return_rate_desc: Percentage of orders that were returned.
sales_over_time_desc: Bar chart showing daily sales volume to identify peak days.
sales_by_channel_desc: Breakdown of where customers shop (Online vs Store).
category_pie_desc: Distribution of sales across different product categories.
status_pie_desc: Operational health check: Completed vs Returned/Cancelled orders.
top_products_desc: Table highlighting best sellers and their profit margins.
revenue_contribution_desc: Treemap showing which products drive the most revenue.
kpis_based_completed: KPIs are based on completed orders only to ensure accuracy.
data_filtered_date: Data is automatically filtered by your selected date range.
orders_table_desc: Used to calculate sales volume and order-related KPIs.
products_table_desc: Used for product identification and grouping.
customers_table_desc: Used for basic customer contribution insights.
dashboard_aggregates_data: This dashboard aggregates data for high-level decision making.
perf_overview_desc: This dashboard tracks sales efficiency and performance quality to help you understand why sales are growing, slowing, or leaking operationally.
perf_q5: Is operational execution supporting sales volume?
sales_growth_desc: Measures the direction and speed of sales change vs previous period.
conversion_rate_desc: Orders divided by visits. Shows efficiency of interest to orders.
revenue_per_customer_desc: Total Revenue / Unique Customers. Indicates customer value.
repeat_customers_desc: Percentage of customers who placed more than one order.
discount_impact_perf_desc: Percentage of revenue foregone due to discounts.
avg_fulfillment_desc: Average time from order creation to shipment (hours).
cancelled_desc: Order failure rate indicating sales friction.
orders_vs_completed_desc: Bar chart identifying operational leakage (orders derived but not completed).
revenue_by_channel_desc: Highlights strongest and weakest sales channels (Online, Store, etc.).
new_vs_returning_desc: Pie chart evaluating customer base quality and loyalty.
low_perf_products_desc: Table identifying products with views but low conversion.
conversion_flow_desc: Parallel coordinates chart visualizing the drop-off shape from Views → Orders → Conversion for each product.
perf_customers_table_desc: Used for Repeat and New vs Returning logic.
perf_calc_note: Includes all completed and cancelled orders for operational visibility.
invite_link_description: Share this link with your team members. When they click it, they will be added to your workspace automatically.
enter_details_personalize: Enter your details to personalize your profile.
choose_strong_password: Choose a strong password to protect your data.
enter_code_inbox: Enter the code sent to your inbox.
something_went_wrong_retry: Something went wrong. Please try again.
verification_not_completed: Verification was not completed. Please try again.
sent_verification_code: We sent a verification code to
please_sign_in_accept: Please sign in to accept the invitation...
successfully_joined: You have successfully joined the workspace.
welcome_back_continue: Welcome back! Please sign in to continue
no_items_scheduled: No items scheduled in this range.
no_workload_yet: No workload yet. Assign owners and due dates to see the load chart.
workload_indicator_help: Indicators show overload, healthy load, or available capacity for the selected window.
manage_workflow: Manage your workflow logic and integrations.
start_from_scratch: Start from scratch or use a template
higher_better: Higher is better. Based on overdue vs total items.
upcoming_overdue_range: Upcoming and overdue items within the selected range
no_items_yet: No items yet. Add tasks to see live dashboards.
sleep_exit_instruction: Click anywhere to exit • ← → to switch
fact_1: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
fact_2: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
fact_4: Water can boil and freeze at the same time.
fact_5: There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way.
fact_6: The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer.
fact_7: 20% of Earth's oxygen is produced by the Amazon rainforest.
fact_8: Some metals are so reactive that they explode on contact with water.
fact_9: A teaspoonful of neutron star would weigh 6 billion tons.
sales_insights_patterns_subtitle: Deep sales performance analysis and pattern detection
analysis_insight: Riyadh leads with 45% of sales, followed by Jeddah (25%). Expansion opportunities exist in Abha region.
analysis_overview_text: The Sales Insights & Patterns dashboard focuses on deep sales performance analysis. It uncovers patterns, efficiency, and hidden signals that are not obvious in high-level summaries, helping you identify strengths and weaknesses at a glance.
analysis_q1: How does this help my decisions?
analysis_a1: By showing region-to-agent performance flows, it helps you allocate resources and detect efficiency gaps early.
analysis_q2: How do the table and side chart work?
analysis_a3: Look for imbalances in the flow chart—if one agent or region has high volume but low completion, it signals a process bottleneck.
operational_accuracy_desc: Table data is pulled directly from the `sales_orders` transactional log.
flow_mapping_desc: The Sankey diagram uses a relational join between `orders`, `agents`, and `regions` to map trajectory.
operational_log_desc: Stores raw transactional data for every order.
customer_profiles_desc: Used for customer-specific filtering and search.
gross_revenue_desc: Gross revenue generated before deductions. The top-line health metric.
total_orders_desc: Number of transactions processed in the selected period.
avg_order_desc: Average revenue per transaction. Indicates pricing efficiency.
top_agent_desc: Best performing salesperson based on closed revenue.
top_product_desc: Revenue leader among all products sold.
sales_by_product_desc: Bar chart identifying your most popular and profitable items.
regional_split_desc: Pie chart showing revenue distribution by geography.
agent_performance_desc: Pie chart showing contribution by each sales agent.
operational_log_desc2: Sortable table with raw transactional data for auditing.
hidden_story_desc: Sankey diagram visualizing the flow from Regions to Agents to Status.
forecast_prediction_subtitle: Strategic planning and predictive risk assessment
comparing_trends_targets: Comparing current trends against predictive targets
forecast_insight: Webcam 4K shows the highest deviation from forecast (+52.4%), suggesting an unexpected surge in demand or a conservative initial prediction.
forecast_overview_text: The Forecast & Prediction dashboard tracks sales forecasts and predictive insights to help decision-makers plan ahead and reduce risk. It focuses on future trends rather than historical summaries.
forecast_q1: Are sales on track for the next period?
forecast_q2: Which products or regions are at risk?
forecast_q4: Should we adjust strategy to prevent potential shortfalls?
forecast_a4: Proactive insights allow management to reallocate resources or launch promotions before a predicted risk becomes a reality.
forecast_model_desc: Uses a weighted moving average of historical sales data.
trend_lines_desc: Derived using linear regression and exponential smoothing algorithms.
orders_items_desc: Primary volume data for trend extrapolation.
expected_revenue_desc: Projected revenue for the next 90 days based on historical weighted trends.
forecast_accuracy_desc: Percentage of how closely past predictions matched actual sales outcomes.
risk_level_desc: Overall potential for falling short of forecasted targets (Low/Medium/High).
profit_margin_desc: Projected efficiency ratio indicating expected profit percentage.
growth_rate_desc: Year-over-year projected growth percentage for sales.
pipeline_value_desc: Total potential revenue from opportunities in the sales pipeline.
confidence_score_desc: Statistical confidence level of the forecast model reliability.
deviation_avg_desc: Average forecast error expressed as percentage deviation from actuals.
actual_vs_forecast_desc: ECharts line comparison showing how reality aligns with projections over time.
forecast_per_product_desc: Bar chart comparing current vs projected spend by product category.
risk_distribution_desc: Pie chart visualizing where potential shortfalls are concentrated.
regional_forecast_desc: Horizontal bar chart showing territory performance projections.
decision_table_desc: Actionable log highlighting deviations between current and predicted sales.
deviation_scatter_desc: Companion chart visualizing forecast value vs actual deviation percentage.
funnel_leakage_subtitle: Optimizing lead-to-order flow and minimizing drop-offs
avg_time_conversion_stage: Average time and conversion by stage
funnel_insight: Quote→Order stage takes the longest (7.8 days avg) but maintains 70% conversion. Focus on reducing this cycle time.
funnel_overview_text: Tracks the sales funnel stages and identifies leakage points. This dashboard helps you visualize the journey from Lead to Order, allowing for data-driven optimizations to improve overall conversion.
funnel_q1: Where are we losing the most leads?
funnel_q2: Which sales reps have higher drop-off?
data_sanitation_desc: Excludes test, draft or invalid entries to maintain accuracy.
crm_leads_desc: Entry point for all potential customer interactions.
sales_orders_desc: Fulfillment and completion data for the final stage.
leads_entered_desc: Total number of potential customers entering the top of the funnel.
leads_contacted_desc: Number of leads that received first outreach from sales team.
quotes_sent_desc: Number of price proposals delivered to qualified prospects.
orders_placed_desc: Total closed won deals that converted to actual orders.
funnel_dropoff_desc: Average stage leakage rate across all funnel transitions.
revenue_lost_desc: Financial value of deals that were marked as Lost or dropped out.
deal_size_desc: Average value of won deals indicating deal quality.
main_funnel_desc: ECharts funnel visualization showing lead volume through conversion stages.
dropoff_rep_desc: Bar chart identifying team members with highest leakage rates.
won_lost_desc: Pie chart showing success rate breakdown between won and lost.
heatmap_desc: Matrix view showing stage vs category value loss intensity.
lead_table_desc: Detailed log of leads with stage, date, value and status.
velocity_desc: Companion chart showing average time and conversion by stage.
segmentation_loyalty_subtitle: Personalizing campaigns and maximizing customer lifetime value
segmentation_overview_text: This dashboard provides insights into customer segmentation, loyalty patterns, and CLV (Customer Lifetime Value) analysis to help optimize retention strategies and personalize marketing efforts.
segmentation_q2: How do I identify customers at risk of churning?
segmentation_q3: How effective are our loyalty programs?
rfm_scoring_desc: Customers are scored based on Recency (last purchase), Frequency (purchase count), and Monetary (total spend) values.
clv_calculation_desc: Customer Lifetime Value is estimated using average order value × purchase frequency × expected customer lifespan.
customer_profiles_desc2: Master data for all registered customers with demographic and contact info.
purchase_history_desc: Transaction log used for RFM analysis and spending patterns.
repeat_customer_desc: Percentage of customers who made more than one purchase.
avg_clv_desc: Average predicted lifetime value per customer.
avg_orders_desc: Average number of orders per customer over their lifetime.
engagement_score_desc: Composite score based on recency, frequency, and value metrics.
segmentation_chart_desc: Bar chart showing customer count distribution across value segments.
repeat_onetime_desc: Stacked bar showing loyalty depth comparison by customer type.
revenue_segment_desc: Pie chart showing revenue contribution percentage by segment.
loyalty_curve_desc: Scatter plot showing correlation between order frequency and revenue.
promotions_effectiveness_subtitle: Measuring ROI and optimizing marketing spend impact
promotions_overview_text: Evaluates the impact of marketing campaigns and promotions on revenue and behavior. Helps management optimize ROI and phase out ineffective spend.
promotions_q1: Which campaigns deliver the best ROI?
promotions_q2: Are promotions driving real sales or just discounts?
promotions_q3: Which campaigns reach the right customers?
promotions_a3: Refer to the Customer Participation pie chart to see if your target segments are the ones actually utilizing the promotions.
promo_attribution_desc: Orders are attributed to a campaign if a promo code was applied or if the purchase followed a campaign link within 7 days.
baseline_exclusion_desc: Incremental sales exclude organic baseline estimated from non-promo period averages.
campaign_master_desc: All promotional campaigns and their configurations.
marketing_spend_desc: Budget allocation and spend tracking per campaign.
campaigns_active_desc: Number of currently live promotional events.
total_spend_desc: Marketing budget utilized across all campaigns.
revenue_promo_desc: Attributed gross volume generated from promotions.
promo_conversion_desc: Percentage of engaged customers who completed a purchase.
incremental_sales_desc: Sales above organic baseline attributed to promotions.
engagement_rate_desc: Average clicks and engagement per campaign.
coupon_redemption_desc: Percentage of issued codes that were used.
campaign_performance_desc: Bar chart showing revenue per campaign.
revenue_type_desc: Pie chart of promotion type breakdown.
campaign_impact_desc: Scatter chart showing ROI vs Conversion.
campaign_audit_desc: Detailed ROI and budget tracking per campaign.
campaign_roi_desc: Companion chart comparing budget vs revenue.
show_all_warning: Loading {0} rows may be slow. Continue?
future_spend_budget_impact: Future spend projections and budget impact analysis
supplier_performance_overview: This dashboard evaluates supplier performance based on reliability (on-time delivery), cost stability, and associated risks, helping to optimize the supply chain.
sp_q2: Are we too dependent on specific suppliers?
sp_q4: Which suppliers pose the highest risk?
avg_lead_time_desc: Average days from order placement to receipt.
cost_variance_desc: Difference between standard/contract cost and actual invoiced cost.
supplier_dependency_desc: Score (0-100) indicating reliance on top suppliers (higher = more risk).
dispute_rate_desc: Percentage of orders resulting in quality or billing disputes.
preferred_suppliers_desc: Number of suppliers marked as 'Preferred' or 'Strategic'.
supplier_concentration_desc: Percentage of total purchase spend concentrated in the top 3 suppliers.
spend_per_supplier_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) showing total spend volume.
lead_time_per_supplier_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) comparing speed of delivery.
supplier_performance_table_desc: Detailed metrics (Spend, On-Time %, Risk) per supplier.
risk_scatter_matrix_desc: Scatter plot (ECharts) correlating Spend (X) vs Lead Time (Y) vs Risk (Bubble).
sp_calc_risk_formula: derived from weighted factors: Financial Stability, Geo-Political, Performance.
cost_control_overview: This dashboard focuses on financial efficiency, identifying areas where actual spending deviates from the budget and highlighting opportunities for cost reduction.
cc_q5: How is our budget allocation distributed?
total_cost_desc: Total actual spend calculated from approved purchase orders.
budget_variance_desc: Percentage difference between Actual Cost and Budget.
cost_per_category_desc: Average spend across active purchasing categories.
negotiation_savings_desc: Total secured savings (Quote Price - Final Price).
price_volatility_desc: Measure of price fluctuation for key items over time (0-100).
high_risk_items_desc: Count of items significantly over budget or with supply instability.
optimization_opportunities_desc: Count of flagged potential savings (e.g., volume discounts).
cost_efficiency_desc: Ratio of achieved savings to total spending potential, indicating optimization effectiveness.
cost_vs_budget_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) comparing actual spending vs planned budget by category.
monthly_cost_trend_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) showing cost fluctuation patterns over months.
cost_allocation_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) showing spend distribution by category.
savings_breakdown_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) showing cost optimization sources (Negotiation, Volume Discount, Contract Terms, Process Efficiency).
item_cost_variance_desc: Detailed list of items with cost, budget, and variance percentage.
cost_deviation_radar_desc: Radar chart (ECharts) visualizing budget adherence by category with actual vs planned overlay.
dependency_risk_overview: This dashboard measures operational risk by analyzing reliance on specific suppliers, identifying single points of failure, and tracking risk exposure across the supply chain.
dr_q1: Are we too reliant on specific suppliers?
dr_q2: What is our overall risk exposure?
dr_q4: How stable is our supply chain?
dependency_ratio_desc: Percentage of total spend concentrated in the top 5 suppliers.
single_supplier_desc: Count of material categories sourced from only one vendor.
risk_exposure_desc: Percentage of spend allocated to high-risk entities.
backup_supplier_desc: Average number of alternative suppliers per category.
avg_switching_cost_desc: Estimated financial impact of changing a primary supplier.
risk_alerts_desc: Active warnings (e.g., bankruptcy news, severe delays).
stability_score_desc: Computed 0-100 index of supply chain robustness.
mitigation_progress_desc: Percentage of risk mitigation actions that have been completed.
dependency_by_category_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) showing dominant supplier share per category.
risk_trend_desc: Stacked bar chart (Recharts) showing high/medium/low risk distribution over time.
risk_levels_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) classifying suppliers by Low/Med/High risk.
diversification_score_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) showing sourcing diversification levels across categories.
risk_detail_table_desc: List of suppliers with their respective impact and risk scores.
network_dependency_graph_desc: Network graph (ECharts) visualizing connections between categories and suppliers.
dr_calc_dependency_formula: = Max(Single Supplier Spend) / Total Category Spend.
forecast_planning_overview: This dashboard helps anticipate future purchasing needs, estimate budget impacts, and visualize uncertainty ranges to support proactive inventory and cash flow management.
fp_q1: How is the forecasted spend calculated?
fp_a1: We use a weighted moving average of the last 12 months, adjusted for seasonal factors and known contract changes.
fp_a2: It represents the statistical probability that actual spend will fall within the predicted range (Confidence Cone).
fp_a3: This indicator flags potential shortages or price hikes based on market trends and supplier lead time variability.
forecasted_spend_desc: Projected total expenditure for the next period.
category_growth_desc: Highest projected increase among all categories.
planned_orders_desc: Number of purchase orders scheduled or drafted.
confidence_level_desc: Statistical certainty of the current forecast model.
variance_trend_desc: Gap between forecasted and actual spend, tracking improvement over time.
forecast_per_category_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) comparing current vs projected spend.
spend_projection_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) showing monthly projected spend trajectory.
future_allocation_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) showing expected budget distribution.
budget_utilization_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) showing quarterly actual and forecasted budget usage.
forecast_diff_table_desc: Detailed comparison of last period actuals vs next period forecast.
confidence_cone_desc: Area chart (ECharts) visualizing the range of probable outcomes.
reorder_planning_overview: This dashboard ensures stock levels are maintained efficiently by flagging items needing replenishment vs those that are overstocked.
rp_q2: How many days of stock do we have?
rp_a3: The inventory level that signals replenishment is needed. It accounts for lead time and safety stock.
reorder_qty_needed_desc: Total units required to restore safety levels.
days_of_stock_left_desc: Runway calculation based on sales velocity.
planning_confidence_desc: Reliability of demand vs supply data.
reorder_qty_by_sku_desc: Bar chart (Recharts) showing replenishment volume per item.
stock_coverage_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) grouping items by days of supply.
threshold_wave_desc: Visualizes urgency of items approaching zero.
warehouse_performance_overview: This dashboard evaluates the operational efficiency of warehouse locations, focusing on space utilization, speed, and accuracy.
wp_q2: How fast are we fulfilling orders?
picking_time_avg_desc: Minutes to pick an average order.
error_rate_kpi_desc: Percentage of orders with picking/packing errors.
capacity_usage_desc: Pie chart (ECharts) of free vs used space.
facility_list_desc: Table detail of specific warehouse stats.
